newsitem.title: USA: Rocky Mountain sees 1996 loss of $0.46 shr.
newsitem.headline: Rocky Mountain sees 1996 loss of $0.46 shr.

text.p: Rocky Mountain Internet Inc said it expects to report a net loss for fiscal 1996 of about $2.3 million, or $0.46 per share.

The company also said it expects to report fourth quarter revenue of about $1.2 million, compared with $384,000 in the year-ago period. The company said the increase in revenue was due to expansion efforts.

The company also said its revenue for 1996 will be about $3.3 million versus $1.2 million in 1995 -- an increase of 180 percent. Final audited results will be announced during the first quarter of 1997, the company said, adding that it will focus on achieving positive earnings in the second half of 1997.
